result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allen Robert Steinke

records.addlTxt:
9:17 AM Defendant Allen Robert Steinke in court.  Attorney Stephen P. Rypel in court for Allen Robert Steinke.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense has discovery, and has provided it to his client. Still needs an offer on 21CF666. Has offer on 22CF593. 
State forwards offer on 21CF666. 
Court sets another further proceeding for Defense to review offer with client.
Hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

8:32 AM Defendant Allen Robert Steinke appeared by Zoom.  Attorney Stephen P. Rypel in court for Allen Robert Steinke. Prosecuting attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Preliminary hearing on September 7, 2022 at 10:15 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 01:23 PM Defendant Allen Robert Steinke in court with attorney Stephen P. Rypel.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Court grants request, repayment at rate of $75.00 per month commencing 9/1/2022.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 10:18 AM Defendant Allen Robert Steinke in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant requests the court appoint counsel. Defendant sworn. Court grants request, repayment at rate of $75.00 per month commencing 9/1/2022.  Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:16 AM Defendant Allen Robert Steinke in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
The Court places its conflict on the record.
The parties do not object to the Court hearing the matter as it just for scheduling purposes. 
The Defendant states he has contact a private attorney, Marcus Sengstock, to retain their services. 
The Court will toll the time limits and adjourn the matter.
The Court orders the Defendant to go directly to the office of Marcus Sengstock to sign the retainer.  Hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

01:55 PM Defendant Allen Robert Steinke in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden appears as friend of the court.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
